Topic.Title: IRS Black Ops unit of Obama SS attacks conservatives.

Message.Msg: Congress passes the laws that the IRS enforces. One of the laws is that Political contributions are not deductible so why are we criticizing the IRS for not giving 501(c)4 status to the T-Party. Are they not Political? I think all this is a smoke screen that Obama hopes will take some heat off of Benghazi.

Topic.Title: IRS Black Ops unit of Obama SS attacks conservatives.

Message.Msg: You bring up an excellent point. Union dues are deductible even though they are VERY political. Many of the IRS regulations are subject to interpretation making it very difficult to administer. We would do well to throw income tax out and replace it with a Federal Sales Tax collected by the states and passed on to the federal government provided the federal government is operating within the federal constitution.

Topic.Title: Finally we find out "What difference...does it make?"

Message.Msg: ...“To see someone call Benghazi a lie and pretend Iraq wasn't is simply mind-boggling…” Would you expect anything less from the folks who wanted everyone to believe that Oliver North was trading arms for hostages with arch-enemy Iran to fund an unconstitutional war in Central America (thus violating the Boland Amendment) while destroying documents and banging Fawn Hall in the basement of the White House, all supposedly unbeknownst to the man upstairs who was just eating jelly beans, napping or being advised by his wife’s astrologer? Fourteen indictments and eleven convictions later, the next President, who was Vice President at the time but also claimed to be “out of the loop”, having just been defeated in his re-election bid, somehow found justification in granting pardons to this band of traitors. But Benghazi is on scale with starting illegal wars? How many forget that The International Court of Justice ruled that during Iran-Contra The United States had violated international law in 16 decisions, including encouraging human rights violations in Nicaragua? You people are so obviously desperate that you continue to make comedic spectacles of yourselves at every opportunity. There are serious issues facing this country that the majority of citizens would like to see continue to be addressed by the President they elected. Continuing with your “obstruct any and everything” for political gain with high-school-dropout-car-thieves- turned- millionaires like Darrell Issa leading the way, will most certainly backfire in the ‘14 elections. But you also lately have done nothing to convince anybody that you learn anything from your mistakes. So keep at it.

Topic.Title: IRS Black Ops unit of Obama SS attacks conservatives.

Message.Msg: The problem was they specifically targeted these groups for extra scrutiny and not other political groups. Additionally the issue here is whether the groups would have to disclose their donors or not, not whether they would get a tax deduction--it is campaign finance law not tax law. My feeling is that the 501(c)4 category should not exist at all, or should still require donor disclosure. Of course, that is only the tip of the iceberg on what I think about campaign finance reform. Of course, fake ricky's comments are what I have come to expect from self-described conservatives these days. Outlandish and incendiary. This is why you people have no credibility.

Topic.Title: Finally we find out "What difference...does it make?"

Message.Msg: " Iraq is well beyond whatever happened with Benghazi." Now there is a childish argument if I ever heard one. Lies are lies and pointing out a greater lie does not make a lie the truth. Let's just stick to the problem at hand even though Obama is trying to divert us into problems at the IRS that have existed since 1916.

Topic.Title: Finally we find out "What difference...does it make?"

Message.Msg: "How is what the Republicans are doing today, in your opinion, is much different from what the Democrats did, and are still doing to Bush?" That's not even a question, winholder. It's not "oh, Democrats did something so Republicans can too." It is someone lied, persistently for months for the purpose of starting a war of choice. What is the proper response to that, Democrat or Republican? And what is the proper response to less than perfectly clear information for about an ongoing national security issue? And then, what is the proper response when the same people who lied in 2003 write a report that is clearly a lie? What is the proper response who did nothing in 2003 but who now pretend Benghazi is an impeachable or jail-worthy event? And finally, what is the proper response to people like you, so partisan, so willfully gullible, so invested in decades old lies, as to become a party to evil?

Topic.Title: Finally we find out "What difference...does it make?"

Message.Msg: ...“Now there is a childish argument if I ever heard one. Lies are lies…” – wilkes Childish arguments are suggesting that two grown adults having a mutually consensual liaison are an impeachable offense (particularly when several of the main accusers are hypocritically involved in the exact same thing), while intentionally lying to start a war that kills hundreds of thousands of people is no big deal. Oh, that’s right, it wasn’t the BJ…it was the perjury about it. Right! Of course he lied about it…what would you do if you were stupid enough to do that while President…come right out and admit it when your wife didn’t know about it? Was that really, really immature and stupid? You betcha’. But not anywhere as immature and stupid as trying to make it an impeachable offense, while ignoring Watergate, Iran-Contra, or Yellow cake uranium. Many Presidents have had illicit affairs…but nobody died over it and nobody was impeached. You guys are the poster children for childish arguments.

Topic.Title: Finally we find out "What difference...does it make?"

Message.Msg: "Lies are lies and pointing out a greater lie does not make a lie the truth." There were no lies with Benghazi. At worst you had confusion/reduced transparency for about a week during an ongoing situation. Compared to knowing and persistent lies for months and years for the purpose of starting a war of choice? I think I can make a value judgement there about which is worse. Next thing you know you'll be comparing this to fun with cigars in the Oval Office. You are still attempting to normalize what Bush did. By no means is it comparable to Benghazi. It is comparable to the Gulf of Tonkin incident, or the sinking of the USS Maine prior to the Spanish-American War. Those are the only two comparable experiences in our history.

Topic.Title: Finally we find out "What difference...does it make?"

Topic.Title: A new request from the White House.

Message.Msg: "emergency rooms having been turned into free clinics for anythig but emergencies" You're a few decades behind, one of the reasons to have a new health care law was to address this long standing problem. Health care was broken and unsustainable, now we have progress towards a solution. Next year congress gets to go on the exchange like everyone else, what's your problem. As time goes on we can work toward further solutions. Postive, upbeat, optimistic thinking to how to solve problems rather than pessimistic, negative, depressing adherence to what didn't work. If you have a plan nothing changes. My plan went up $6/mo this year, the lowest increase I can remember. Medicare premiums went down this year.
